<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FITNESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/fitness-industry-shifts-athome-offerings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Have to Be at Home and So Do Gyms
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Peloton bike" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NjEvcGVsb3Rvbl9iaWtlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two recent developments show that, in the coronavirus-era fitness industry, it’s best to offer a service that can be used without masking up. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 1: Peloton pops </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company’s earnings report caused financial reporters to sound like fitness instructors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yahoo Finance </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/peloton-q3-2020-earnings-200520211.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes that</a></span><span> Peloton “smashed Wall Street’s sales and operating profit forecasts.” Revenue grew 66% to $525 million. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Peloton added an insane 1.1 million users to its digital fitness platform from March 16 to April 30,” YF added. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Peloton shares hit an all-time intraday high Wednesday”—CNBC (that’s the biz journalist equivalent of Denis Morton saying, “If you can’t get out of it, get into it”). The stock is up nearly 100% since March 12.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Point being, with most gyms closed, equipment and online classes like Peloton’s are selling like hotcakes that make your legs stronger. But it doesn’t have the WorkoutFH windfall all to itself—Echelon, a company that makes more affordable internet-connected bikes, sold five times more equipment than it expected in Q1. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And there are other hills ahead for Peloton, like when to re-deploy its expensive treadmill, which it stopped delivering in mid-March. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 2: Gold’s folds </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sort of. Gold’s Gym <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golds-gym-files-bankruptcy-chapter-11-coronavirus-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced Monday</a> that it had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. Its gyms will remain open, and it hopes to resurface from bankruptcy before August, but it’s not a good omen for brick-and-mortar fitness. Plus, the owner of New York Sports Clubs and Lucille Roberts gyms hired a law firm to help restructure its debt last month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The fitness trend spawned by the pandemic is simple—bring workouts into homes. What’s more complicated is how gyms that once depended on in-person sweat sessions stay in business after switching to virtual classes, especially since many of us are enjoying our taste of life without membership fees.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/adp-reveals-devastating-job-losses-april?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
20+ Million Lost Jobs in April
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Payroll company ADP said 20.2 million private sector jobs <a href="https://apnews.com/e15c0d5c75b2079bb25847eeb4ca317f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were cut</a> in April, by far the worst report in this survey’s history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But this report is just a warmup toss. We’ll get a more detailed look at the labor market on Friday when the government releases its employment figures for the month. Considering the economy has been shutdown wholesale since mid-March, St. Louis Fed President James Bullard said the upcoming jobs report could be "one of the worst ever."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The following charts from ADP show where jobs were lost across goods-producing and service-providing sectors. Check out "Leisure & Hospitality."</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1. Goods-producing: 4.23 million jobs lost</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NTAvZ29vZHNfcHJvZHVjaW5nX2pvYnNfbnVtYmVycy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>

<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2. Service-providing: 16 million jobs lost</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84NTIvc2VydmljZS1wcm92aWRpbmdfc2VjdG9yX2pvYnNfbG9zc2VzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/supreme-court-hears-oral-arguments-contraception-coverage-case?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Story Involves Sex, Religion, <em>and </em>Politics
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, kinda. Yesterday, the Supreme Court <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/06/supreme-court-clashes-over-trump-contraceptive-coverage-rules.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heard arguments</a> over which businesses should be required to provide free contraceptive coverage to female employees. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>2010’s Affordable Care Act, aka Obamacare, required all employers except houses of worship and religiously affiliated nonprofits to provide free birth control coverage. In 2014, the Supreme Court decided that <em>some</em> for-profit businesses could claim religious objections as well. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Then in 2018, the Trump administration further broadened the category of exempt employers by adding those that have </span><span><em>moral </em></span><span>objections to contraception. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lower courts blocked the rules, the Trump administration and a Catholic nonprofit asked for an appeal, and now here we are. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The justices argued via teleconference (a Supreme Court first starting this week), mostly along partisan lines. The pivotal vote<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>could be Big Daddy John Roberts—the Chief Justice suggested he thinks the existing decisions provide a sufficient balance of religious freedom/access to healthcare. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But this story ends like <em>The Sopranos</em>: We’re not really sure what’s going to happen. A decision is expected over the summer.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether we’re maxing out on burpees, doing yoga in the living room, or just trying to get our nutrition right, we know how essential protein is to achieving our health and fitness goals. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And in order to get the necessary levels of protein all up in our high-functioning, newsletter-writing bodies, we turn to <a href="https://bit.ly/ascent-morning-brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ascent</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An extremely efficient dose of 25 grams—the equivalent of 4 large eggs or 3 cups of yogurt—mixes in just 4-6 oz of water or blends beautifully into All Pro Running Back<strong style="color:#000"> Christian McCaffrey’s </strong>breakfast smoothie (ask him yourself).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Is their whey protein powder delicious? No duh. But it’s also <strong style="color:#000">clean, contains zero artificial ingredients, and is made with native whey</strong>—the least-processed whey protein available.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/samsung-heir-vows-end-family-succession?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Awkward Family Dinners Ahead for Samsung Heirs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Succession" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9Dtye59YLYQpIwQWpv/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Succession" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9Dtye59YLYQpIwQWpv/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/HBO</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The "Samsung heir" group chat is about to get ugly—and not just because of the green text bubbles. Yesterday, Samsung's de facto boss Lee Jae-yong announced he would <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/6/21249040/jay-y-lee-apology-samsung-heir-bribery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not be passing leadership</a> of the South Korean tech conglomerate on to his children.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lee Jae-yong, the third generation of Lees to lead Samsung, apologized for past scandals and attempts to consolidate his family's control of the company.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A few years ago, Lee served one year in prison for bribing now-impeached former president Park Geun-hye to ensure his stranglehold on the Samsung dynasty. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lee also backtracked on Samsung’s traditional "<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/19/world/asia/samsung-tower-protest.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no union</a>" stance following decades of pressure, apologizing for executives caught trying to sabotage efforts to unionize. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Samsung's fractured relationship with its workers and the South Korean government can be traced to one point of origin: “All of the problems basically started from this succession issue,” said Lee. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ The company's got much bigger issues, though. </strong>The Samsung Lions started the KBO season 0-2. They'll look to get their first win vs. the NC Dinos this morning. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F05%2F06%2Fsamsung-heir-vows-end-family-succession" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/fortnite-adds-100-million-players-one-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sorry for Talking About Fortnite Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But don’t be surprised if even your grandparents start asking to squad up—<em>Fortnite</em> said it crossed <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/6/21249497/fortnite-350-million-registered-players-hours-played-april?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">350 million registered players</a>, up from about 250 million in March 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know big numbers have lost their luster in the age of trillion-dollar stimulus packages, but we’ll still try to wow you—<em>Fortnite</em> players logged 3.2 billion hours on the game in April. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That’s over 36,500 </span><span><em>years</em></span><span> of gaming condensed into one month.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following the massive success of rapper Travis Scott's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/20/travis-scott-embarks-worldwide-concert-tour-inside-fortnite?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual tour</a> last month (over 12.3 million concurrent players tuned in to watch), <em>Fortnite</em> developer Epic Games launched an entire “Party Royale” game mode without weapons. The only point is to mess around and party with your friends.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And Epic’s parties...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Are pretty epic. Big-name DJs Steve Aoki and deadmau5 are headlining <em>Fortnite’s</em> latest in-game concert this Friday night to convince players to spend even more time inside Epic’s burgeoning digital universe. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/06/business/gap-reopening-retail-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Gap Inc.</a></span><span> is planning to reopen up to 800 of its stores by the end of the month.</span>

In Part II, Chamath argues that the U.S. economy needs billionaires like the NBA needs LeBron James. <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/can-capitalism-survive-chamath-palihapitiya-isnt-sure/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Listen here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Left brain, meet right brain: </strong>If you have a little extra time (you do), you might enjoy trying these <a href="https://arbitrarilyclose.com/home/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">#MathArtChallenges</a>, which, you'll be surprised to hear, combine math and art.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Join #FinTwit:</strong> We asked followers to name the best finance-related accounts to follow on Twitter. <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1257764330570997761?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here ya go</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/brews-bookshelf-may-7?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzMvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every other Thursday, we're here to save you from your screenpocalypse with a few book recommendations. </em></p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tech: </strong></span><span><a href="https://shoshanazuboff.com/book/about/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Age of Surveillance Capitalism</em></a></span><span> by Shoshana Zuboff is an eye-opening look at how tech companies follow every step of our lives.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Entrepreneurship:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.harpercollins.com/9780062273208/the-hard-thing-about-hard-things/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Hard Thing About Hard Things</em></a></span><span> by Ben Horowitz is considered one of the best books about business, with straight-shooting advice on what to do when things go wrong.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bio:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.simonandschuster.com/books/Shoe-Dog/Phil-Knight/9781501135927?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Shoe Dog</em></a></span><span> is the memoir of Nike’s media-shy cofounder Phil Knight, who turned a $50 loan from his dad into a multibillion-dollar athleticwear giant. Thanks to readers Tom L. and Eduardo R. for reminding us about this gem. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Want to submit your own book recommendation? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/O2tX0X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share it here</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F05%2F06%2Fbrews-bookshelf-may-7" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Three+must-read+business+books+for+you+to+check+out+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/06/brews-bookshelf-may-7&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo recent developments show that, in the coronavirus-era fitness industry, it’s best to offer a service that can be used without masking up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 1: Peloton pops \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company’s earnings report caused financial reporters to sound like fitness instructors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYahoo Finance \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/peloton-q3-2020-earnings-200520211.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites that\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Peloton “smashed Wall Street’s sales and operating profit forecasts.” Revenue grew 66% to $525 million. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Peloton added an insane 1.1 million users to its digital fitness platform from March 16 to April 30,” YF added. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Peloton shares hit an all-time intraday high Wednesday”—CNBC (that’s the biz journalist equivalent of Denis Morton saying, “If you can’t get out of it, get into it”). The stock is up nearly 100% since March 12.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePoint being, with most gyms closed, equipment and online classes like Peloton’s are selling like hotcakes that make your legs stronger. But it doesn’t have the WorkoutFH windfall all to itself—Echelon, a company that makes more affordable internet-connected bikes, sold five times more equipment than it expected in Q1. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd there are other hills ahead for Peloton, like when to re-deploy its expensive treadmill, which it stopped delivering in mid-March. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 2: Gold’s folds \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSort of. Gold’s Gym \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/golds-gym-files-bankruptcy-chapter-11-coronavirus-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced Monday\u003c/a\u003e that it had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. Its gyms will remain open, and it hopes to resurface from bankruptcy before August, but it’s not a good omen for brick-and-mortar fitness. Plus, the owner of New York Sports Clubs and Lucille Roberts gyms hired a law firm to help restructure its debt last month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe fitness trend spawned by the pandemic is simple—bring workouts into homes. What’s more complicated is how gyms that once depended on in-person sweat sessions stay in business after switching to virtual classes, especially since many of us are enjoying our taste of life style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, kinda. Yesterday, the Supreme Court \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/06/supreme-court-clashes-over-trump-contraceptive-coverage-rules.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheard arguments\u003c/a\u003e over which businesses should be required to provide free contraceptive coverage to female employees. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003e2010’s Affordable Care Act, aka Obamacare, required all employers except houses of worship and religiously affiliated nonprofits to provide free birth control coverage. In 2014, the Supreme Court decided that \u003cem\u003esome\u003c/em\u003e for-profit businesses could claim religious objections as well. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThen in 2018, the Trump administration further broadened the category of exempt employers by adding those that have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003emoral \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eobjections to contraception. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLower courts blocked the rules, the Trump administration and a Catholic nonprofit asked for an appeal, and now here we are. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe justices argued via teleconference (a Supreme Court first starting this week), mostly along partisan lines. The pivotal vote\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003ecould be Big Daddy John Roberts—the Chief Justice suggested he thinks the existing decisions provide a sufficient balance of religious freedom/access to healthcare. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut this story ends like \u003cem\u003eThe Sopranos\u003c/em\u003e: We’re not really sure what’s going to happen. A decision is expected over the summer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: past scandals and attempts to consolidate his family's control of the company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA few years ago, Lee served one year in prison for bribing now-impeached former president Park Geun-hye to ensure his stranglehold on the Samsung dynasty. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLee also backtracked on Samsung’s traditional #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eno union\u003c/a\u003e\" stance following decades of pressure, apologizing for executives caught trying to sabotage efforts to unionize. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Samsung's fractured relationship with its workers and the South Korean government can be traced to one point of origin: “All of the problems basically started from this succession issue,” said style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut don’t be surprised if even your grandparents start asking to squad up—\u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e said it crossed \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/6/21249497/fortnite-350-million-registered-players-hours-played-april?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e350 million registered players\u003c/a\u003e, up from about 250 million in March 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe know big numbers have lost their luster in the age of trillion-dollar stimulus packages, but we’ll still try to wow style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat’s over 36,500 \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eyears\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of gaming condensed into one month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing the massive success of rapper Travis Scott's \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/20/travis-scott-embarks-worldwide-concert-tour-inside-fortnite?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evirtual tour\u003c/a\u003e last month (over 12.3 million concurrent players tuned in to watch), \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e developer Epic Games launched an entire “Party Royale” game mode without weapons. The only point is to mess around and party with your friends.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd Epic’s parties...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAre pretty epic.
